title: Dennis Burnett
text:
Dennis Burnett (born 27 September 1944) is an English former <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="defender%20%28football%29">defender</a>.
Club career.
He started his career as a youth team player at <a href="West%20Ham%20United%20F.C.">West Ham United</a>, making his first team debut in October 1965. He played 66 games in all competitions for West Ham scoring three goals. In 1967 Burnett moved to <a href="Millwall%20F.C.">Millwall</a>, for £15,000, where he made over 250 appearances, taking over the captaincy whenever <a href="Harry%20Cripps">Harry Cripps</a> was injured. In October 1973, for £70,000, he signed for <a href="Hull%20City%20A.F.C.">Hull City</a>. He also played for <a href="St.%20Louis%20Stars%20%28NASL%29">St. Louis Stars</a>, <a href="Brighton%20%26amp%3B%20Hove%20Albion%20F.C.">Brighton & Hove Albion</a> and <a href="Shamrock%20Rovers">Shamrock Rovers</a>.
Burnett signed for Shamrock Rovers under <a href="Johnny%20Giles">John Giles</a> in October 1977 and made his debut the same day as <a href="Gordon%20Banks">Gordon Banks</a> made his <a href="League%20of%20Ireland">League of Ireland</a> debut. 
He made a total of 11 appearances before departing in December 1977.
Burnett went on to be assistant manager with Sussex side, <a href="Lancing%20F.C.">Lancing</a> and played in their 2–1 defeat by <a href="Horsham%20YMCA%20F.C.">Horsham YMCA</a> in the <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a> in 1994, a month before his 50th birthday.
With Norwegian club <a href="SK%20Haugar">SK Haugar</a> he lost the <a href="1979%20Norwegian%20Football%20Cup">1979 Norwegian Football Cup</a> final.
After football.
Burnett ran a painting and decorating firm in the south of England after retiring from football and has been involved in club hospitality for West Ham United at <a href="Boleyn%20Ground">Upton Park</a>.
